basics.benefits_moa: Paxil is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin activity in the brain, which regulates mood.
basics.bottom_line: Paxil is good for treating depression and anxiety but it causes more weight gain, sleepiness, and withdrawal symptoms than other antidepressants.
downsides: Can cause more sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate than most antidepressants.
More likely to cause minor weight gain (1 to 5 pounds) or make you feel sick if you miss a dose than other antidepressants.
Can harm an unborn child, so you can't take it if you're pregnant.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than age 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Paxil may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Paxil is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Paxil may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Paxil is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Paxil with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Paxil suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Paxil suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Paxil can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Paxil can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

description_processed.orig: Paxil can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Paxil can harm a developing fetus. Don't use it while pregnant, especially in the first trimester. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

carousel_items: Usually taken together with other medicines for better blood pressure control.
Can cause drowsiness, headache, dizziness, and dry mouth.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
If side effects don't go away, talk to your doctor about alternatives.
The weekly patch form can have fewer side effects.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.
Extended release tablet also used to treat ADHD.

basics.benefits_moa: Clonidine is an alpha-2 agonist. It works in the brain to tell your blood vessels to relax, and it lowers the activity of certain stress hormones. This lowers blood pressure.
basics.bottom_line: Clonidine is a good addition if you need more than one medicine to control your blood pressure, but it has a lot of side effects. You can't miss doses.
downsides: Has a lot of side effects compared to other blood pressure-lowering medicine because it works in the brain.
The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Has a lot of side effects compared to other blood pressure-lowering medicine because it works in the brain.
The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: Can be added to other blood pressure-lowering medicines if you need additional blood pressure control.
Available in a weekly patch for people that aren't good at taking medicine by mouth.
Works in the brain, so it can help treat some nervous system and psychiatric conditions.
Under the brand name Kapvay, it's used to treat ADHD in children and teenagers.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, or have a sudden rise of blood pressure that can result in complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the guidance of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, or have a sudden rise of blood pressure that can result in complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the guidance of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Citalopram may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Citalopram is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Citalopram may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Citalopram is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Citalopram with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Citalopram with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

description_processed.orig: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Citalopram suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: People with a history of heart or liver problems and people that are older are at increased risk for heart problems from taking Citalopram. These people need a lower maximum dose (20 mg or less a day). Heart and blood tests may be required before treatment.

description_processed.orig: People with a history of heart or liver problems and people that are older are at increased risk for heart problems from taking Citalopram. These people need a lower maximum dose (20 mg or less a day). Heart and blood tests may be required before treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Citalopram can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Citalopram can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

basics.benefits_moa: Venlafaxine is a serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulate mood.
basics.bottom_line: Venlafaxine is good for treating depression and anxiety. May work when other antidepressants haven't, it's but more likely to cause side effects and withdrawal symptoms than other antidepressants.
downsides: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.
Not the best option for people with high blood pressure.
Overdosing on this medication could be fatal.
It's more likely to cause nausea and vomiting or make you feel sick if you miss a dose than other antidepressants. Also causes more sleepiness than others.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

carousel_items: Can cause drowsiness, headache, dizziness, and dry mouth.
For ADHD: Might take up to 2 weeks to see effects.
For high blood pressure: Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
If side effects don't go away, talk to your doctor about alternatives.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

basics.benefits_moa: Clonidine is an alpha-2 agonist. Researchers don't know exactly how it works for ADHD. It works in the brain and lowers the activity of certain stress hormones, but it's not a stimulant like many ADHD medicines.
basics.bottom_line: Clonidine is a non-stimulant option to manage ADHD symptoms and behaviors, but it can lower your blood pressure.
downsides: Can lower blood pressure.
The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Can lower blood pressure.
The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: Can be used alone or together with a stimulant-type medicine to treat ADHD.
In studies, it improved attention span and lowered hyperactivity and impulsivity in children and adolescents ages 6 to 17.
Also treats blood pressure and some nervous system and psychiatric conditions.

upsides_processed.orig: Can be used alone or together with a stimulant-type medicine to treat ADHD.

Also treats blood pressure and some nervous system and psychiatric conditions.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause drowsiness, headache, dizziness, and dry mouth.
For ADHD: Might take up to 2 weeks to see effects.
For high blood pressure: Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
If side effects don't go away, talk to your doctor about alternatives.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal (rebound hypertension)
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, and a sudden rise of blood pressure that can produce complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the supervision of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, and a sudden rise of blood pressure that can produce complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the supervision of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Clonidine impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low heart rate (bradycardia)

basics.benefits_moa: Lexapro is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin activity in the brain, which regulates mood.
basics.bottom_line: Lexapro is good for treating depression and anxiety. Might be less likely to cause side effects than some antidepressants, but not the best choice for people with heart or liver problems.
downsides: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.
More likely to cause minor weight gain (1 to 5 pounds) than other antidepressants.
Can cause an irregular heartbeat if you take a high dose (20 mg a day, or more).
Not a good option for you if you have heart or liver problems.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.

The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work, and might have side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works for you and that you can tolerate.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Lexapro may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Lexapro is not approved for use in children younger than age 12.

description_processed.orig: Lexapro may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Lexapro is not approved for use in children younger than age 12.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Lexapro with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

Your risk goes up if you use Lexapro with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Lexapro suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Lexapro may affect your heart. If you have any risk factors, the maximum dose for you may be 10 mg or lower. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

description_processed.orig: Lexapro may affect your heart. If you have any risk factors, the maximum dose for you may be 10 mg or lower. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Lexapro can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Lexapro can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

description_processed.orig: Lexapro can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

Don't drive while taking Gabapentin until you know how the medication affects you.

Neurontin and generic forms of Gabapentin have the same ingredients as Gralise and Horizant, but are dosed differently. Make sure you know which form you're taking since they are used for different purposes.
Take the extended-release tablet with food.

clock.tip: Works faster and stronger when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Gabapentin is an antiepileptic and nerve pain reliever. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it has a similar structure to GABA, a neurotransmitter that calms nerves in the brain and spinal cord.
basics.bottom_line: Gabapentin is an old seizure disorder medicine that's now used to treat nerve-related pain caused by different conditions.
downsides: Gabapentin is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, or confusion.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Gabapentin can cause seizures. This is even more likely if you drink alcohol, so it might not be the best medication for heavy drinkers.

downsides_processed.orig: Gabapentin is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, or confusion.

upsides: Originally used to treat epilepsy (partial seizures), but now it primarily treats neuropathic pain that's caused by nerve stimulation or damage.
Studies show it's most effective for nerve pain from diabetes, shingles, and fibromyalgia (a painful muscle condition).
It's available as a generic, so it's less expensive than similar medications.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. risks_warnings.title: Neurologic and psychiatric side effects (children)
risks_warnings.description: Using Gabapentin may cause emotional ups and downs (lability), aggressive behavior, problems concentrating, restlessness, hyperactivity, and changes in school performance. When these side effects occur, they are usually mild to moderate in intensity.

description_processed.orig: Using Gabapentin may cause emotional ups and downs (lability), aggressive behavior, problems concentrating, restlessness, hyperactivity, and changes in school performance. When these side effects occur, they are usually mild to moderate in intensity.

risks_warnings.title: Serious rash and multiple organ problems
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin has been associated with a serious rash and multiple organ problems known as Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS). It can be life-threatening. Call a doctor immediately if you experience: fever, rash, hives, swollen glands, lip or tongue swelling, yellowing of skin or whites of the eyes, unusual bruising or bleeding, severe fatigue or weakness, unexpected muscle pain, frequent infections.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin has been associated with a serious rash and multiple organ problems known as Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS). It can be life-threatening. Call a doctor immediately if you experience: fever, rash, hives, swollen glands, lip or tongue swelling, yellowing of skin or whites of the eyes, unusual bruising or bleeding, severe fatigue or weakness, unexpected muscle pain, frequent infections.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin impairs thinking abilities (concentration, alertness) and physical abilities (reflexes, motor skills) needed to drive a car, operate machinery, or participate in potentially dangerous activities. Be careful.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin impairs thinking abilities (concentration, alertness) and physical abilities (reflexes, motor skills) needed to drive a car, operate machinery, or participate in potentially dangerous activities. Be careful.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Gabapentin suddenly can increase the number of seizures. Talk to your doctor before making any changes to your medication. It's safer to reduce the dose slowly over at least one week before stopping medication.

drugs.name: Pristiq

carousel_items_processed.orig: Takes 8 to 12 weeks to see full effects on mood.
Can cause sweating and high blood pressure.
Stop taking slowly to avoid withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Pristiq may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Pristiq is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Pristiq may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Pristiq is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Pristiq with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Pristiq suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Pristiq can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

description_processed.orig: Pristiq can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Pristiq can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

description_processed.orig: Pristiq can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Pristiq can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

description_processed.orig: Pristiq can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

surveys.tip: ALSO BE SURE TO TAKE MED. ABOUT THE SAME TIME EACH DAY IF YOU MISS YOUR TIME DO NOT JUST TAKE ANY TIME. SKIP THAT DAY AND GET BACK ON YOUR REGIMENT THE NEXT DAY.  YOU WILL SEE A DIFFERENCE, DO NOT GO OVER 1 HOUR OR 1 1/2 HOURS OVER IF SO SKIP TO NEXT DAY.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: I HAVE BEEN TAKING EFFEXOR FOR OVER 5 YEARS I WENT THROUGH A 14 MONTH STUDY WITH CLOSE MONITORING EVERY MONTH WITH PROFESSIONAL DR.'S AND NURSES AND THE DRUG STUDY PERSON.  IT IS VERY MUCH WORTH THE TIME AND EFFORTS I WENT THROUGH FOR THE RESULTS.  DO NOT JUST STOP TAKING THE MEDICATION ON YOUR OWN!!!!! YOU MUST BE EASED OFF THE EFFEXOR GENTLY AND NOT ALL AT ONCE.  I CAN'T STRESS THIS ENOUGH IT WOULD BE KINDA LIKE DT'S FROM ALCOHOL ABUSE.  I HAVE VERY FEW HOT FLASHES AND A MUCH BETTER ATTITUDE ON EVERYTHING. AS HOT FLASHES WORSEN WITH AGE THE MEDACINE MAY NEED TO BE INCREASED.  YES IT IS COVERED BY MOST INSURANCE.
